Vietchau Nguyen wrote:

> I am new to JUnit and so my question may be obvious... Is there a way to
> run all test methods in a test class by create only one instance of the
> class in JUnit? That is, not creating a new instance of the class for
> each test?
> 
> I use
> 
> org.junit.runner.JUnitCore.run(myClass.class)
> 
> in the main program
> 
> and if myClass has 100 test methods, the program will create 100
> instances of myClass.
> 
> I find that wasteful of resource because each time it will have to do
> all the setup again.

JUnit wants to make all tests isolated from each other, so that if test 
#2 fails, test #5 can still pass. This is why it always creates a new 
instance of the test class for each test.

If you really don't want your tests to be isolated, then I agree this is 
a waste of resources, but I have two questions:

1. Do you really want your tests /not/ to be isolated?
2. Do the tests run quickly enough even if you "waste" the resources?

Take care.
